Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: while the negative consequences of supply constraints in some sectors, particularly basic food, have been alleviated by the strategic solutions facilitated by türkiye, the upward trend in producer and consumer prices continues on an international scale.\n                '}]

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: leading indicators show that the recovery in the global economy is sustained with some deceleration.\n                '}]
2025-05-03 22:35:27,906 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence suggests a sustained recovery in the global economy, albeit with some deceleration, which may imply a more dovish stance to support continued economic growth."
}

34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: along with the pandemic-related rise in unit costs, exchange rate and credit developments restrain the demand-side disinflationary effects, and the trends of core inflation indicators have increased.\n                '}]

"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence highlights the restraining effects of exchange rate and credit developments on disinflationary effects, and the increase in core inflation indicators, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance."
}

inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: accordingly, the committee evaluated the necessity of increasing the functionality of market mechanisms through the simplification process of the current micro and macro-prudential framework along with monetary tightening.\n                '}]

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: nonetheless, producer inflation remained on the rise due to lagged effects and the ongoing disruptions in supply chains.\n                '}]

"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence highlights a continued increase in producer inflation, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance."
}

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: on the other hand, imports remain on a downward slide, largely due to consumption and investment goods, which led to historically high current account surplus in august – october period.\n                '}]
2025-05-03 22:35:43,187 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence reports a historically high current account surplus, indicating a stronger trade balance, which may justify a looser monetary policy stance."
}

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: still, the committee noted that You are also given an annotation guide for the feature: stance.\n            Strictly follow the guide; do not invent new criteria or labels.\n\n            Your task is to classify whether it is "hawkish", "neutral", "dovish", or "irrelevant" and briefly justify your choice.\n            \n            Instructions:\n            1. label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{cbrt}{6} Economic Status, Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY), Inflation Rates, Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the depreciation in the turkish lira, widespread wage increases and tax adjustments are expected to place additional cost-side pressure on inflation in the near term.\n                '}]
2025-05-03 22:35:47,118 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence highlights potential inflationary pressures from the depreciation of the Turkish lira, wage increases, and tax adjustments, which may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance."
}

label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{cbrt}{6} Economic Status, Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY), Inflation Rates, Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: despite successive decreases in june and july, consumption goods imports remain elevated in seasonally adjusted terms.\n                '}]

"justification": "The sentence highlights that consumption goods imports remain elevated, suggesting potential inflationary pressures and justifying a tighter monetary policy stance."

management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: regarding the cyclical state of the economy, the data released for the first quarter indicate that economic activity remains above the potential and aggregate demand conditions continue to be at inflationary levels.\n                '}]
2025-05-03 22:35:54,619 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence suggests that economic activity is above potential and aggregate demand conditions are at inflationary levels, implying potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance."
}

points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the increased likelihood of the adoption of protective policies in the us following the elections poses a downside risk to the pace of growth and employment in emerging economies.\n                '}]

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: this outlook is preserved even when other transport vehicles that stimulate industrial production are excluded.\n                '}]

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the 24-month-ahead inflation expectation is 22.04%.\n                '}]
2025-05-03 22:36:06,326 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence reports a high inflation expectation, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance."
}

Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the low course of food Interest Rates, Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy, and Foreign Trade Balance.\n\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item Economic Status: Represents the overall condition of the Turkish economy, including inflation, unemployment, and growth trends.\n    \\item Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY): Fluctuations in the value of the Turkish lira relative to other currencies, influencing trade and inflation.\n    \\item Inflation Rates: Measures the rate of price increases for goods and services in Turkey, impacting purchasing power and policy decisions.\n    \\item Interest Rates: The CBRT\'s benchmark policy rate, affecting borrowing costs, investment, and overall economic activity.\n    \\item Government Debt \\& Fiscal Policy: Represents Turkey’s government borrowing levels and fiscal management, influencing monetary policy choices.\n    \\item Foreign Trade Balance: Measures Turkey’s exports and imports, with trade surpluses or deficits impacting currency strength and policy decisions.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\paragraph{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``Thus, the unemployment rate declined by 0.4 points compared to previous month and realized as 9.6\\%.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: The sentence reports a decline in unemployment, potentially justifying a more hawkish approach to curb inflation.\n\n    \\item ``Thus, the rise in automobile prices amounted to 34.01\\% in the first six months of 2023.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Hawkish}: This sentence highlights a significant increase in automobile prices, suggesting potential inflationary pressures that may prompt a tighter monetary policy stance.\n    \n    \\item ``The committee has therefore decided to keep the interest rates at current levels.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Neutral}: The sentence simply states that interest rates will remain unchanged, reflecting no immediate bias toward tightening or easing policy.\n    \n    \\item ``Annual inflation remained flat in rents, but decreased in other subgroups.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: With inflation showing stability in rents and declines elsewhere, the overall price pressure appears subdued, which may support expansionary monetary policy.\n    \n    \\item ``In sum, economic activity is expected to recede in the third quarter.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Dovish}: This forward-looking forecast of a slowdown in economic activity points to the possibility of an easing monetary stance to promote economic growth.\n    \n    \\item ``Impact analyses of the CBRT\'s regulations are conducted for all components of the framework by assessing their impact on inflation, interest rates, exchange rates, reserves, expectations, securities, and financial stability with a holistic approach.\'\'\\\\ \n    \\textbf{Irrelevant}: The sentence focuses on a comprehensive evaluation process of regulatory impacts without providing any specific insight into monetary policy stance.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Central Bank of Turkey}}\n\\label{tb:cbrt_mp_stance_guide} \\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n%\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n%\n\\textbf{Economic Status} & When inflation is decreasing, unemployment is rising, or economic growth is weak. & When inflation is increasing, unemployment is low, and economic growth is strong. & When economic indicators remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Currency Exchange Rate (Turkish Lira - TRY)} & When the lira depreciates significantly, increasing import costs and inflationary pressure. & When the lira appreciates, reducing import costs and signaling potential monetary tightening. & When the exchange rate remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation is slowing down, suggesting room for rate cuts. & When inflation is rising, requiring tighter monetary policy. & When inflation remains within the target range. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & Low money supply, any increase in M2, demand for loans is higher. & High money supply, demand for goods increase, demand for loans decrease. & N/A. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Government Debt} & When government debt increases significantly, prompting expectations of monetary stimulus to manage borrowing costs. & When debt decreases, indicating fiscal discipline and allowing tighter monetary policy. & When debt levels remain stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Foreign Trade Balance} & When the trade deficit widens, indicating higher imports than exports, potentially justifying a weaker lira and looser monetary policy. & When the trade deficit narrows or a surplus is recorded, strengthening the lira and allowing for tighter policy. & When the trade balance remains relatively unchanged. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Key Words and Phrases} & When the sentiment is growth oriented, e.g., "accommodative," "maximum employment," "price stability," "heightened consumption," "low inflation." & When sentiment is restrictive, indicating a focus on "price stability" and "sustained growth." & Use of neutral terms, e.g., "mixed," "moderate," "reaffirmed." & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pmi data for the services sector, which was the major driving force of global economic activity particularly in the first half of the year, significantly declined in the october-november period both in the advanced economies group and the emerging economies group.\n                '}]
